channel.title: Games That you were dissappointed with
channel.description: Hai guise haven't been on here in aaaages due to certain events happening etc etc but I thought i'd return with this. I brought Need For Speed Undercover recently and was fairly disappointed with it due to 1. It's far too easy 2. it's shorter than portal 3. It's the exact same map as most wanted just it's been re modelled. The story line doesn't make that much sense either. One minute people hate you the next they're your friends etc etc. So yeah anyone else had any games they were disappointed with?

item.title: Games That you were dissappointed with
item.dc:creator: Pokemon_Eater
item.description:
Shadow of Chernobyl. Not the game itself, I loved it, but the ending completely threw you into the frying pan. First you have to fight through a floor of about sixty Monolith and whatever health kits you bought or found (Barkeep, Sakharov and Sid only sell about a combined total of nine at a time, so good luck.) Also high radiation is about as deadly as the bullets themselves. Finally if you decide to get the canon ending you have to go do the same thing twice. The teleport thing was kind of cool at the end and the cutscene was too, but it wasn’t worth two hours of my life getting that.

Read full topic

item.title: Games That you were dissappointed with
item.dc:creator: Ham_Solo
item.description:
Fnoigy:

To be fair, it originally was planned to be. I think it was going to be some crazy fusion of third-person shooter and RTS and some other shit seamlessly blended together (demonstrated in a totally pre-scripted E3 demonstration), like some crazy Hostile Waters: Anteus Rising, but then was just turned into an inoffensively generic FPS by Microsoft.

I’ve seen that E3 demo, with free world and all that.
Too bad.

Read full topic

item.source: Games That you were dissappointed with

item.title: Games That you were dissappointed with
item.dc:creator: Rollofthedice
item.description:
I seriously thought Darkest of Days would be awesome when I first heard of it. I mean, come on. You’re a time-travelling fixer-upper that gets to kill confederate soldiers with modern assault rifles.

Once I played it, however, I wanted to punch the developer in the face. When you have an FPS that manages to be incredibly boring, then you screwed up in more ways than I can imagine.

Read full topic

item.title: Games That you were dissappointed with
item.dc:creator: tycho_magnetic_anoma
item.description:
Ratchet Deadlocked. I remember I was excited for the release, and got it the day it came out. I beat it in a few days, and was pretty underwhelmed. I traded it in maybe a week or two later.
I’ve always been a big ratchet and clank fan, and that game was really the only misstep in the series. It tried WAY too hard to change the formula and ended up being a lackluster game.
I couldn’t tell you how glad I was when Tools of Destruction returned to the original style.

Read full topic

item.title: Games That you were dissappointed with
item.dc:creator: SoaringScout
item.description:
Ham Solo:

NFSHP2

What?

Fungus:

Blur. looked cool and all, but the brakes… oh my god the brakes. I cant make a turn to save my life in that game. either seems to do nothing or I spin insanely out of control. I then wonder if they even bothered to playtest the thing

That happens quite a lot in Grand Theft Auto 4 and the Mafia 2 demo. It’s impossible to go fast in those games without spinning out of control when attempting to turn.
